publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3887 Pauline McNeill: UN Fact-finding Mission to the Gaza Strip—That the Parliament welcomes the appointment by the United Nations of the South African judge and former war crimes prosecutor, Richard Goldstone, to lead a fact-finding mission to the Gaza Strip; notes that Mr Goldstone will investigate all alleged violations of international humanitarian law, including the use of white phosphorus, before, during and after the recent Israeli military campaign in Gaza; further notes that Martin Uhomoibhi, president of the UN Human Rights Council, has stated that the mission will be independent and impartial, and calls on the international community actively to encourage full Israeli cooperation with the mission. Supported by: Bill Wilson*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Jackie Baillie*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Patrick Harvie*, Jamie Hepburn*, Des McNulty*, Stuart McMillan*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Patricia Ferguson*, Bob Doris*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Marlyn Glen*, Jim Tolson*, Elaine Smith*, Cathy Jamieson*, Bill Kidd*, Sandra White*, Bill Butler*, Trish Godman*, Elaine Murray*, Liam McArthur*
S3M-3887 UN Fact-finding Mission to the Gaza Strip (lodged on 7 April 2009) Malcolm Chisholm*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Robin Harper*, Marilyn Livingstone*
S3M-3887 UN Fact-finding Mission to the Gaza Strip (lodged on 7 April 2009) Gil Paterson*
S3M-3887 UN Fact-finding Mission to the Gaza Strip (lodged on 7 April 2009) Hugh Henry*
S3M-3887 UN Fact-finding Mission to the Gaza Strip (lodged on 7 April 2009) Sarah Boyack*
